overview: 1 Timothy is Paul's pastoral instruction to his young protégé leading the church in Ephesus. It covers church leadership, sound doctrine, and conduct for various groups within the congregation.

verses.text: Let no one despise you for your youth, but set the believers an example in speech, in conduct, in love, in faith, in purity.
For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evils. It is through this craving that some have wandered away from the faith and pierced themselves with many pangs.
For there is one God, and there is one mediator between God and men, the man Christ Jesus.

passages.title: Qualifications for Overseers
passages.summary: Paul lists character qualities for church leaders—overseers and deacons—emphasizing integrity and family life.

passages.title: Fight the Good Fight
passages.summary: Paul charges Timothy to pursue godliness, fight the good fight, and keep the faith until Christ's appearing.

facts.text: 1 Timothy, 2 Timothy, and Titus are called the 'Pastoral Epistles' because they address pastoral leadership.
The saying 'money is the root of all evil' is a misquotation—Paul says the 'love of money' is the root.
Timothy was from Lystra, his mother Eunice and grandmother Lois were believers who taught him Scripture from childhood.

figures.name: Paul
figures.description: The aging apostle passing on leadership wisdom to the next generation of church leaders.

figures.name: Timothy
figures.description: Paul's 'true child in the faith,' a young pastor needing encouragement to lead boldly despite his youth.

videos.title: 1 Timothy Overview
videos.description: The Bible Project explores Paul's pastoral guidance for Timothy.
